item.title: Longs in perl
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

From what I remember, the maximum size of an integer in perl refers to the system architecture…so on a 32-bit processor, you can only use 32-bit scalar integers…I believe you can use a special flag to allow for 64 bit integers when compiling perl, but I’ve always used ActivePerl so I’ve never done that. That’s just what I think I remember about it…I’m not totally positive.

Alternatively, you could always use the BigInt object from the Math package, but I dunno if that’s what you want…

Read full topic
